case_vignette: Two days following the home birth of her son, a mother brings the infant to the pediatric emergency room because of bilious vomiting. He is unable to pass meconium and his abdomen is distended. Endoscopic biopsy of the proximal colon demonstrates an absence of Meissner’s and Auerbach’s plexi in the bowel wall.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Pediatrics and Neonatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
My baby has been throwing up a greenish substance and he hasn't been able to have his first poop; his belly also looks swollen.
How old is your baby?
My baby is two days old.
Has your baby passed any meconium (the first stool of a newborn)?
No, he hasn't passed any meconium.
Is there a family history of cystic fibrosis?
I'm just a patient and I don't have any medical knowledge or information about family history in the vignette provided.
Understood, thank you for the additional information. Is your baby currently on any medications or supplements?
No, my baby is not on any medications or supplements.
**Final Diagnosis:** Neonatal Intestinal Obstruction
